sentences.en: " There are always jobs, " Challenger says. " Companies are always hiring. But the competition is much tougher. "
sentences.cn: Challenger 说: “ 工作总会有的. 公司总是在招聘, 只是竞争更加残酷了. ”

sentences.en: A fight was scheduled between the world boxing champion and the challenger.
sentences.cn: 世界拳击冠军和挑战者之间将有一橙赛.

sentences.en: Challenger broke free, lumbered past the launch tower.
sentences.cn: “挑战者”号突然腾起, 笨拙地沿着发射塔上升.

sentences.en: He was thrashed in his last bout against the challenger.
sentences.cn: 他在向对手发起的最后一击中被彻底击败了.

sentences.en: One heavy blow to the chin and the challenger went out like a light.
sentences.cn: 下巴挨了一重拳以后,挑战者立即被打得不省人事了.

sentences.en: The challenger took the champion by surprise by beating him.
sentences.cn: 挑战者因击败冠军而令他感到吃惊.

sentences.en: The champion, within striking distance, gave the challenger a severe blow.
sentences.cn: 拳王站在打击得到的距离内, 给挑战者一记重击.

sentences.en: The Frenchman held his own against the challenger.
sentences.cn: 这名法国人顶住了挑战者的进攻。

sentences.en: The judges gave the nod to the winning challenger.
sentences.cn: 裁判们对挑战者的胜利给予确认.

sentences.en: the official challenger for the world championship title
sentences.cn: 世界冠军头衔的正式挑战者

sentences.en: The strongest challenger, Texas Democrat Martin Frost, has withdrawn from the race.
sentences.cn: 最强劲的挑战者，德克萨斯州的民主党人马丁·弗罗斯特已经退出了竞选。

sentences.en: The young challenger managed to keep on his feet for three rounds.
sentences.cn: 那位年轻的挑战者设法坚持了3个回合而没被击倒.

sentences.en: They, the members of the Challenger crew, were pioneers.
sentences.cn: 他们 -- 挑战者号全体机组人员是开拓者.

sentences.en: This could be the winning game for the challenger, who only needs two more points for the championship.
sentences.cn: 这场比赛可能是挑战者获胜, 他只要再得两分就得冠军了.

sentences.en: Well, today we can say of the Challenger crew: Their dedication was, like Drake's, complete.
sentences.cn: 今天对挑战者号机组人员我们可以这样说: 像德雷克一样, 他们的奉献是毫无保留的.

sentences.en: With a powerful left hook he knocked his challenger defenseless.
sentences.cn: 他用一记重重的左钩拳将对手打得失去了防卫能力.

words.tran_cn: 挑战的；引起挑战性兴趣的
要求；质疑；反对；向…挑战；盘问（challenge的ing形式）

trans.tran_en: A challenger is someone who competes with you for a position or title that you already have, for example being a sports champion or a political leader
